summary: This is a City & State New York political newsletter from February 20, 2019, covering various New York political news. It includes a brief mention of the Child Victims Act and its legislative history, but contains no direct information about Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or legal proceedings.

persons.name: Margaret Markey
persons.context: Mentioned as the former Assemblywoman who persistently pushed for the Child Victims Act in the state Legislature, motivated by her son's abuse by a priest.

events.title: Public Advocate Special Election
events.description: Special election for New York City Public Advocate.

events.title: NYC Power 100 Luncheon
events.description: City & State hosts a luncheon to honor individuals on its NYC Power 100 list.

events.title: NYC School of Data Conference
events.description: Kickoff event for NYC's Open Data Week, featuring workshops and talks on civic technology.

keyFacts: The document is a general New York political newsletter with no substantive content related to Jeffrey Epstein, his crimes, associates, or legal case.
It briefly references the Child Victims Act and its legislative champion, former Assemblywoman Margaret Markey.
The newsletter's primary focus is on New York state and city politics, policy issues, and upcoming events.
